content: The supernatural plays a significant role in Macbeth by serving as a driving force to move the plot forward and to explore the themes of ambition, guilt, and fate. Examples of supernatural elements in the play include the three witches who prophesy Macbeth's rise to power and ultimately his downfall, the appearance of Banquo's ghost at the banquet, and the visions and hallucinations experienced by Macbeth and Lady Macbeth. The supernatural is also used to create an eerie and ominous atmosphere, which adds to the overall mood of the play. Overall, the supernatural elements in Macbeth serve as a powerful tool to enhance the themes and provide a sense of mystery and suspense.
